item.title: Morbidology the Podcast – 260: Stephen Wendy Reid
item.description: Stephen and Wendy Reid had moved back to Concord, New Hampshire, to enjoy their retirement. Over lockdown, they had discovered a love of hiking, relishing the numerous trails that were just stone’s throw away from their apartment. But one afternoon in April of 2022, the couple vanished while on their routine hike.

item.title: Morbidology the Podcast – 259: Lynette Volschenk
item.description: Residents of the Seesig apartments in Bellville, Cape Town, South Africa, were settling down for the evening on the 21st of August, 2019. But amidst the tranquil ambiance, a woman residing on the ninth floor was jolted from her routine by piercing screams echoing from the apartment directly above hers…

item.title: Morbidology the Podcast – 258: Alfie Steele
item.description: The tranquil streets of Droitwich, nestled in the historic county of Worcester, England, were thrust into the spotlight on the 18th of February, 2021. That afternoon, a distressing phone call pierced the calm, as a woman dialed emergency services to report a harrowing discovery: her son, unresponsive, lying in the bathtub. Sponsors: EZ Melts: EZ Melts […]

item.title: Did he Really Vanish from the Mall?: D’Wan Sims
item.description: On 11 December, 1994, four-year-old D'Wan Sims vanished from a mall in Livonia, Michigan. However, surveillance doubted his mother's story..

item.title: Morbidology the Podcast – 257: Paige Birgfeld
item.description: In 2007, in Grand Junction, Colorado, an eight-year-old girl grew increasingly frustrated with her mother one night. Her mother had assured her she'd be home early after numerous late nights at work. However, as darkness fell over the area, her mother still hadn't returned...

item.title: Morbidology the Podcast – 256: Brenda Powell
item.description: Michelle Gaffney was at work at the University of Mount Union in Ohio on the 3rd of March, 2020, when she received a message from a parent of a student. When Michelle called back, she could hear loud thumps in the background along with a deafening scream.

item.title: The End of a Serial Killer: Neal Falls
item.description: In 2015, a woman in Charleston, West Virginia, shot dead a man who tried to kill her. She was unaware of it at the time, but he was a suspected serial killer..

item.title: Morbidology the Podcast – 255: Eli Hart
item.description: Police in Orono, Minnesota, received a report of a vehicle on the road with a smashed back windscreen and a missing tyre on the 20th of May, 2022. When officers responded to the scene and pulled the car over, they immediately noticed blood in the back seat, and on the driver’s hands…

item.title: Morbidology the Podcast – 254: Matthew Pyke
item.description: In today’s digital age, obsessions can spital into existence through the vast expanses of the internet. They can even blur the lines between virtual fantasy and reality. In September of 2008, detectives in Nottingham, in the United Kingdom, were investigating a murder when their focus shifted to the online world of gaming.

item.title: Morbidology the Podcast – 253: Thad Phillips Christian Steiner
item.description: Thad Phillips was asleep on his couch in Baraboo, Wisconsin, on the night of July 29, 1995. In the haze of half-sleep, he suddenly became aware of somebody lifting him. He thought that it was his father taking him to bed, but when he emerged from his daze, he found himself standing outside, with an older teenage boy standing before him.
